p: Plants from Hyptidinae produce several classes of specialized metabolites. The compounds isolated until now belong to the classes of diterpenes ( 1– 73), triterpenes ( 74– 113), lignans ( 114– 148), α-pyrones ( 149– 191), flavonoids ( 192– 221), phenolic acids ( 222– 236) and monoterpenes and sesquiterpenes, as components of essential oils ( 237– 295). Alkaloids are very rare in this group of plants. Although there are reports of detection of alkaloids using phytochemical and histochemical screenings, the only compound identified was ( R)-5-hydroxypyrrolidin-2-one, isolated from Condea verticillata (Jacq.) Harley & J.F.B.Pastore (syn. Hyptis verticilla ta Jacq .) ( Kuhnt et al., 1995).
